required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Association Between Mother and Child Weight Gain: Statistical Methods With Validation
clinical_study.official_title: Association Between Mother and Child Weight Gain: Statistical Methods With Validation

brief_summary.textblock: Using retrospective data from the Vanderbilt University Medical Center electronic health record, the investigators will study the association between mother's weight / weight change before, during, and after pregnancy and the development of childhood obesity up until 5 years of age.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators are extracting de-identified retrospective data from the Vanderbilt University Medical Center electronic health record for mother-child pairs. From this data, the investigators will study the association between mothers' weight before, during, and after pregnancy, as well as her weight change during those periods, and its association with the risk of her child developing obesity during the first 5 years of their life. Included mothers must be 18 years of age or older at the time of delivery with at least one weight measurement and at least one height measurement; they must have at least one child with weight/length measurements at birth and one additional same day height/weight measurement at or before 5 years of age.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of children with childhood obesity during the first 5 years of life
primary_outcome.description: BMI by age classification greater than the 95th percentile

arm_group.description: Mothers who have delivered at VUMC and their children who are seen by Vanderbilt-affiliated physicians.

study_pop.textblock: Mothers who have delivered at VUMC and their children who are seen by Vanderbilt-affiliated physicians.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Mother-child pairs in the Vanderbilt University Medical Center (VUMC) electronic health record.
- The mothers must have at least one height measurement after the age of 16 years.
- The mothers must also have at least one weight measurement during pregnancy.
- The child must have birth length and weight measures and at least one same day height/weight measurement during their first 5 years of life.
